data.name: DEFAULT_EVENT_SOURCE_ID_STRING
data.comment: Stash this for use when the exception logger is out of scope.

data.name: ERRMSG_ARG_IS_NULL
data.value: The specified argument is a null reference.
data.comment: This is a general purpose error message, intended for reporting null reference exceptions.

data.name: ERRMSG_ARG_IS_NULL_OR_EMPTY
data.value: The argument is a null reference or the empty string.
data.comment: This is a general purpose error message, intended for reporting null reference exceptions.

data.name: ERRMSG_ARG_OUT_OF_RANGE
data.value: Value of {0} is out of range; it must be between {1} and {2}.

data.name: ERRMSG_BADSTRING
data.comment: Use this template to reporty a string that cannot be processed. The string is expected to be appended; to that end, there is a single substitution token. If you want it quoted, wrap it in quotes before you pass it into string.Format or one of its cousins.

data.name: ERRMSG_EMPTY_STRING_NEVER_VALID
data.value: The empty string is never valid in this context.
data.comment: Created for use by string extension method EnumFromString (defined in WizardWrx.Core.dll), this message will probably find other uses sooner or later.

data.name: ERRMSG_INTEGER2HEXSTR_INVALID_INPUT
data.value: The type of the first argument, pintegralValue, is invalid.{2}Argument value = {0}{2}Argument type = {1}{2}{2}Limitations of the underlying formatting engine{2}restrict this method to integral types.{2}
data.comment: The IntegerToHexStr method constructs the message for the ArgumentException exception that it throws when fed a non-integral type.

data.name: ERRMSG_INVALID_COMMAND_LINE
data.value: At least one command line argument is invalid.
data.comment: Exit code 2 is now reserved for reporting invalid command line arguments.

data.name: ERRMSG_NULLREF_NEVER_VALID
data.value: A null reference to a string is never valid in this context.
data.comment: Created for use by string extension method EnumFromString (defined in WizardWrx.Core.dll), this message will probably find other uses sooner or later.

data.name: ERRMSG_RUNTIME
data.comment: Exit code 1 is reserved for reporting miscellaneous run-time exceptions.

data.name: ERRMSG_SUCCESS
data.comment: This message is seldom written; it is a place holder for exit code zero in the table of error messages that is loaded into the state manager singleton.

data.name: MSG_OBJECT_REFERENCE_IS_NULL
data.comment: Use this string to represent a null reference in output messages.

data.name: MSG_STRING_IS_NULL_OR_EMPTY
data.comment: Use this string to represent a null reference or the empty string in output messages.

data.name: MSG_THE_EMPTY_STRING
data.comment: Use this string to represent the empty string in output messages.

data.name: MSG_VALUE_IS_INVALID
data.comment: Use this string to report that the value of a variable is invalid.

data.name: MSG_VALUE_IS_VALID
data.comment: Use this string to report that the value of a variable is valid.

data.name: REGISTRY_VALUE_TYPE_BINARY
data.comment: Use these strings to describe the type of a Registry value.

data.name: REGISTRY_VALUE_TYPE_DWORD
data.comment: Use these strings to describe the type of a Registry value.

data.name: REGISTRY_VALUE_TYPE_EXPAND
data.comment: Use these strings to describe the type of a Registry value.

data.name: REGISTRY_VALUE_TYPE_MULTI
data.comment: Use these strings to describe the type of a Registry value.

data.name: REGISTRY_VALUE_TYPE_QWORD
data.comment: Use these strings to describe the type of a Registry value.

data.name: VERSION_STRING_PART_BUILD_ABBR
data.comment: Use these strings as abbreviated labels for the four parts of a canonical version number string.

data.name: VERSION_STRING_PART_BUILD_LONG
data.comment: Use these strings as long labels for the four parts of a canonical version number string.

data.name: VERSION_STRING_PART_BUILD_SHORT
data.comment: Use these strings as short labels for the four parts of a canonical version number string.

data.name: VERSION_STRING_PART_MAJOR_ABBR
data.comment: Use these strings as abbreviated labels for the four parts of a canonical version number string.

data.name: VERSION_STRING_PART_MAJOR_LONG
data.comment: Use these strings as long labels for the four parts of a canonical version number string.

data.name: VERSION_STRING_PART_MAJOR_SHORT
data.comment: Use these strings as short labels for the four parts of a canonical version number string.

data.name: VERSION_STRING_PART_MINOR_ABBR
data.comment: Use these strings as abbreviated labels for the four parts of a canonical version number string.

data.name: VERSION_STRING_PART_MINOR_LONG
data.comment: Use these strings as long labels for the four parts of a canonical version number string.

data.name: VERSION_STRING_PART_MINOR_SHORT
data.comment: Use these strings as short labels for the four parts of a canonical version number string.

data.name: VERSION_STRING_PART_REVNO_ABBR
data.comment: Use these strings as abbreviated labels for the four parts of a canonical version number string.

data.name: VERSION_STRING_PART_REVNO_LONG
data.comment: Use these strings as long labels for the four parts of a canonical version number string.

data.name: VERSION_STRING_PART_REVNO_SHORT
data.comment: Use these strings as short labels for the four parts of a canonical version number string.
